text:
Compiling in the modules/aaa directory with make local-build.  During the 
build of each module.c to its .lo file, I get numerous syntax errors from  
src/apr/libtool.  Tracing it out takes me to the grep -e test at lines  4265 
and 4268.  At this point the script's dependendcy_libs env vars equal "-
L/usr/local/Berkeley -L/usr/local/lib".  Problem #1 is that Solaris's grep 
doesn't support a "-e" option.  I fixed this easily fixed by switching to 
egrep. However, problem #2 surfaces in those same lines in that the S and D 
env vars used in testing are both null, leading to yet another syntax 
complaint out of egrep. The S var is assigned the PWORKDIR var at line 4262 
which is null, and nowhere assigned in the entire Apache distribution. I could 
find no assignment whatsoever for the D var in the libtool script.  The make 
doesn't blow up, but I don't if that's a problem or not.

---dave k
creator: dwkoehler@comcast.net
jerenkrantz@apache.org
text:
Wow.  This looks like a bug due to the machine that httpd-2.0.44 was rolled on.  As far as I can tell, the stock version of libtool-1.4.3 does not have these lines.

The only fix I can suggest is to install autoconf and libtool 1.4.3 yourself from the official GNU sources, and re-run buildconf.  You may encounter a problem where apr-util and pcre are not configured correctly due to a shell limitation in Solaris (2.0.44 doesn't configure for me at all on my Solaris machine).  If that happens, you need the latest snapshot of APR and rerun buildconf.

We will make sure this is resolved for the next release.

Thanks for using Apache HTTP Server!

Hmpf.  Well, this seems to be my fault.  I rolled on Gentoo and they seem to 
patch libtool in a way that it becomes non-portable.  This one seems to be
the culprit:

  http://cvs.gentoo.org/cgi-bin/viewcvs.cgi/gentoo-x86/sys-
devel/libtool/files/1.4.3/libtool-1.4.2-portage.patch

Anyway, my lesson learned, I've installed a vanilla libtool in my roll sandbox
now.  Sorry for the inconvenience.  Next release we'll pay extra attention to
this.
creator: striker@apache.org
dwkoehler@comcast.net
text:
Thanx for confirming this.  I do have libtool 1.4.3 installed from the 
Sunfreeware site, so I'll go ahead and re-buildconf the apr stuff.  Also noted 
the build failures in the pcre directory and traced that down to missing 
srcdir and builddir variable defines at the top of Makefile.  They are need 
later on in the make to find the included rules.mk file.  I installed by hand 
and got by this.  Maybe your automake file here needs modification.  Don't 
know how to do that yet.
